page.title: 08Employment in Wilton
page.content:
In Wilton there is not a great deal of employment available. Most people travel the 5 miles to Salisbury to work. The{largest employer in Wilton is {the Royal Wilton carpet factory employing about 200 people. The{felt {mill}employs a further 60. The{army, which has its U.K. headquarters in Wilton, employs some 40 civilians.
{Tourism}provides seasonal work. {Wilton House,}the main attraction, employs some 25 people. The Pembroke Arms, a residential hotel and restaraunt engages extra staff in summer. Other employers are Brewers the agricultural engineers and Moores scrap metal merchants. Farming is no longer a major source of employment.
